content: I’d slap myself for seeing the C-suites and founders at the top and not seeing a lot more reason for it, client focused, than simply about reserving prime spots for the highest paid. For starters, these are the people who have the most power to shape everything else. It is as much about seniority (time invested) in most cases. When a list is built for actual interest, rather than an in-joke for the team, it’s only point is to tell you things about the ethos of the company. You may judge them on it. So why shouldn’t the only ones with the power to actually change it be the first judged?
